00053 struct mdc_getattr_args {
00054         struct obd_export               *ga_exp;
00055         struct md_enqueue_info          *ga_minfo;
00056 };
00057 
00058 int it_open_error(int phase, struct lookup_intent *it)
00059 {
00060         if (it_disposition(it, DISP_OPEN_LEASE)) {
00061                 if (phase >= DISP_OPEN_LEASE)
00062                         return it->it_status;
00063                 else
00064                         return 0;
00065         }
00066         if (it_disposition(it, DISP_OPEN_OPEN)) {
00067                 if (phase >= DISP_OPEN_OPEN)
00068                         return it->it_status;
00069                 else
00070                         return 0;
00071         }
00072 
00073         if (it_disposition(it, DISP_OPEN_CREATE)) {
00074                 if (phase >= DISP_OPEN_CREATE)
00075                         return it->it_status;
00076                 else
00077                         return 0;
00078         }
00079 
00080         if (it_disposition(it, DISP_LOOKUP_EXECD)) {
00081                 if (phase >= DISP_LOOKUP_EXECD)
00082                         return it->it_status;
00083                 else
00084                         return 0;
00085         }
00086 
00087         if (it_disposition(it, DISP_IT_EXECD)) {
00088                 if (phase >= DISP_IT_EXECD)
00089                         return it->it_status;
00090                 else
00091                         return 0;
00092         }
00093 
00094         CERROR("it disp: %X, status: %d\n", it->it_disposition, it->it_status);
00095         LBUG();
00096 
00097         return 0;
00098 }
00099 EXPORT_SYMBOL(it_open_error);
00100 
00101 /* this must be called on a lockh that is known to have a referenced lock */
00102 int mdc_set_lock_data(struct obd_export *exp, __u64 *lockh, void *data,
00103                       __u64 *bits)
00104 {
00105         struct ldlm_lock *lock;
00106         struct inode *new_inode = data;
00107         ENTRY;
00108 
00109         if(bits)
00110                 *bits = 0;
00111 
00112         if (!*lockh)
00113                 RETURN(0);
00114 
00115         lock = ldlm_handle2lock((struct lustre_handle *)lockh);
00116 
00117         LASSERT(lock != NULL);
00118         lock_res_and_lock(lock);
00119         if (lock->l_resource->lr_lvb_inode &&
00120             lock->l_resource->lr_lvb_inode != data) {
00121                 struct inode *old_inode = lock->l_resource->lr_lvb_inode;
00122                 LASSERTF(old_inode->i_state & I_FREEING,
00123                          "Found existing inode %p/%lu/%u state %lu in lock: "
00124                          "setting data to %p/%lu/%u\n", old_inode,
00125                          old_inode->i_ino, old_inode->i_generation,
00126                          old_inode->i_state,
00127                          new_inode, new_inode->i_ino, new_inode->i_generation);
00128         }
00129         lock->l_resource->lr_lvb_inode = new_inode;
00130         if (bits)
00131                 *bits = lock->l_policy_data.l_inodebits.bits;
00132 
00133         unlock_res_and_lock(lock);
00134         LDLM_LOCK_PUT(lock);
00135 
00136         RETURN(0);
00137 }
00138 
00139 enum ldlm_mode mdc_lock_match(struct obd_export *exp, __u64 flags,
00140                               const struct lu_fid *fid, enum ldlm_type type,
00141                               union ldlm_policy_data *policy,
00142                               enum ldlm_mode mode, struct lustre_handle *lockh)
00143 {
00144         struct ldlm_res_id res_id;
00145         enum ldlm_mode rc;
00146         ENTRY;
00147 
00148         fid_build_reg_res_name(fid, &res_id);
00149         /* LU-4405: Clear bits not supported by server */
00150         policy->l_inodebits.bits &= exp_connect_ibits(exp);
00151         rc = ldlm_lock_match(class_exp2obd(exp)->obd_namespace, flags,
00152                              &res_id, type, policy, mode, lockh, 0);
00153         RETURN(rc);
00154 }
00155 
00156 int mdc_cancel_unused(struct obd_export *exp, const struct lu_fid *fid,
00157                       union ldlm_policy_data *policy, enum ldlm_mode mode,
00158                       enum ldlm_cancel_flags flags, void *opaque)
00159 {
00160         struct obd_device *obd = class_exp2obd(exp);
00161         struct ldlm_res_id res_id;
00162         int rc;
00163 
00164         ENTRY;
00165 
00166         fid_build_reg_res_name(fid, &res_id);
00167         rc = ldlm_cli_cancel_unused_resource(obd->obd_namespace, &res_id,
00168                                              policy, mode, flags, opaque);
00169         RETURN(rc);
00170 }
00171 
00172 int mdc_null_inode(struct obd_export *exp,
00173                    const struct lu_fid *fid)
00174 {
00175         struct ldlm_res_id res_id;
00176         struct ldlm_resource *res;
00177         struct ldlm_namespace *ns = class_exp2obd(exp)->obd_namespace;
00178         ENTRY;
00179 
00180         LASSERTF(ns != NULL, "no namespace passed\n");
00181 
00182         fid_build_reg_res_name(fid, &res_id);
00183 
00184         res = ldlm_resource_get(ns, NULL, &res_id, 0, 0);
00185         if (IS_ERR(res))
00186                 RETURN(0);
00187 
00188         lock_res(res);
00189         res->lr_lvb_inode = NULL;
00190         unlock_res(res);
00191 
00192         ldlm_resource_putref(res);
00193         RETURN(0);
00194 }
00195 
00196 static inline void mdc_clear_replay_flag(struct ptlrpc_request *req, int rc)
00197 {
00198         /* Don't hold error requests for replay. */
00199         if (req->rq_replay) {
00200                 spin_lock(&req->rq_lock);
00201                 req->rq_replay = 0;
00202                 spin_unlock(&req->rq_lock);
00203         }
00204         if (rc && req->rq_transno != 0) {
00205                 DEBUG_REQ(D_ERROR, req, "transno returned on error rc %d", rc);
00206                 LBUG();
00207         }
00208 }
00209 
00210 /* Save a large LOV EA into the request buffer so that it is available
00211  * for replay.  We don't do this in the initial request because the
00212  * original request doesn't need this buffer (at most it sends just the
00213  * lov_mds_md) and it is a waste of RAM/bandwidth to send the empty
00214  * buffer and may also be difficult to allocate and save a very large
00215  * request buffer for each open. (bug 5707)
00216  *
00217  * OOM here may cause recovery failure if lmm is needed (only for the
00218  * original open if the MDS crashed just when this client also OOM'd)
00219  * but this is incredibly unlikely, and questionable whether the client
00220  * could do MDS recovery under OOM anyways... */
00221 static void mdc_realloc_openmsg(struct ptlrpc_request *req,
00222                                 struct mdt_body *body)
00223 {
00224         int     rc;
00225 
00226         /* FIXME: remove this explicit offset. */
00227         rc = sptlrpc_cli_enlarge_reqbuf(req, DLM_INTENT_REC_OFF + 4,
00228                                         body->mbo_eadatasize);
00229         if (rc) {
00230                 CERROR("Can't enlarge segment %d size to %d\n",
00231                        DLM_INTENT_REC_OFF + 4, body->mbo_eadatasize);
00232                 body->mbo_valid &= ~OBD_MD_FLEASIZE;
00233                 body->mbo_eadatasize = 0;
00234         }
00235 }
00236 
00237 static struct ptlrpc_request *
00238 mdc_intent_open_pack(struct obd_export *exp, struct lookup_intent *it,
00239                      struct md_op_data *op_data)
00240 {
00241         struct ptlrpc_request   *req;
00242         struct obd_device       *obddev = class_exp2obd(exp);
00243         struct ldlm_intent      *lit;
00244         const void              *lmm = op_data->op_data;
00245         __u32                    lmmsize = op_data->op_data_size;
00246         struct list_head         cancels = LIST_HEAD_INIT(cancels);
00247         int                      count = 0;
00248         enum ldlm_mode           mode;
00249         int                      rc;
00250         ENTRY;
00251 
00252         it->it_create_mode = (it->it_create_mode & ~S_IFMT) | S_IFREG;
00253 
00254         /* XXX: openlock is not cancelled for cross-refs. */
00255         /* If inode is known, cancel conflicting OPEN locks. */
00256         if (fid_is_sane(&op_data->op_fid2)) {
00257                 if (it->it_flags & MDS_OPEN_LEASE) { /* try to get lease */
00258                         if (it->it_flags & FMODE_WRITE)
00259                                 mode = LCK_EX;
00260                         else
00261                                 mode = LCK_PR;
00262                 } else {
00263                         if (it->it_flags & (FMODE_WRITE|MDS_OPEN_TRUNC))
00264                                 mode = LCK_CW;
00265 #ifdef FMODE_EXEC
00266                         else if (it->it_flags & FMODE_EXEC)
00267                                 mode = LCK_PR;
00268 #endif
00269                         else
00270                                 mode = LCK_CR;
00271                 }
00272                 count = mdc_resource_get_unused(exp, &op_data->op_fid2,
00273                                                 &cancels, mode,
00274                                                 MDS_INODELOCK_OPEN);
00275         }
00276 
00277         /* If CREATE, cancel parent's UPDATE lock. */
00278         if (it->it_op & IT_CREAT)
00279                 mode = LCK_EX;
00280         else
00281                 mode = LCK_CR;
00282         count += mdc_resource_get_unused(exp, &op_data->op_fid1,
00283                                          &cancels, mode,
00284                                          MDS_INODELOCK_UPDATE);
00285 
00286         req = ptlrpc_request_alloc(class_exp2cliimp(exp),
00287                                    &RQF_LDLM_INTENT_OPEN);
00288         if (req == NULL) {
00289                 ldlm_lock_list_put(&cancels, l_bl_ast, count);
00290                 RETURN(ERR_PTR(-ENOMEM));
00291         }
00292 
00293         req_capsule_set_size(&req->rq_pill, &RMF_NAME, RCL_CLIENT,
00294                              op_data->op_namelen + 1);
00295         req_capsule_set_size(&req->rq_pill, &RMF_EADATA, RCL_CLIENT,
00296                              max(lmmsize, obddev->u.cli.cl_default_mds_easize));
00297 
00298         rc = ldlm_prep_enqueue_req(exp, req, &cancels, count);
00299         if (rc < 0) {
00300                 ptlrpc_request_free(req);
00301                 RETURN(ERR_PTR(rc));
00302         }
00303 
00304         spin_lock(&req->rq_lock);
00305         req->rq_replay = req->rq_import->imp_replayable;
00306         spin_unlock(&req->rq_lock);
00307 
00308         /* pack the intent */
00309         lit = req_capsule_client_get(&req->rq_pill, &RMF_LDLM_INTENT);
00310         lit->opc = (__u64)it->it_op;
00311 
00312         /* pack the intended request */
00313         mdc_open_pack(req, op_data, it->it_create_mode, 0, it->it_flags, lmm,
00314                       lmmsize);
00315 
00316         req_capsule_set_size(&req->rq_pill, &RMF_MDT_MD, RCL_SERVER,
00317                              obddev->u.cli.cl_max_mds_easize);
00318 
00319         /* for remote client, fetch remote perm for current user */
00320         if (client_is_remote(exp))
00321                 req_capsule_set_size(&req->rq_pill, &RMF_ACL, RCL_SERVER,
00322                                      sizeof(struct mdt_remote_perm));
00323         ptlrpc_request_set_replen(req);
00324         return req;
00325 }
00326 
00327 static struct ptlrpc_request *
00328 mdc_intent_getxattr_pack(struct obd_export *exp,
00329                          struct lookup_intent *it,
00330                          struct md_op_data *op_data)
00331 {
00332         struct ptlrpc_request   *req;
00333         struct ldlm_intent      *lit;
00334         int                     rc, count = 0;
00335         __u32                   maxdata;
00336         struct list_head        cancels = LIST_HEAD_INIT(cancels);
00337 
00338         ENTRY;
00339 
00340         req = ptlrpc_request_alloc(class_exp2cliimp(exp),
00341                                         &RQF_LDLM_INTENT_GETXATTR);
00342         if (req == NULL)
00343                 RETURN(ERR_PTR(-ENOMEM));
00344 
00345         rc = ldlm_prep_enqueue_req(exp, req, &cancels, count);
00346         if (rc) {
00347                 ptlrpc_request_free(req);
00348                 RETURN(ERR_PTR(rc));
00349         }
00350 
00351         /* pack the intent */
00352         lit = req_capsule_client_get(&req->rq_pill, &RMF_LDLM_INTENT);
00353         lit->opc = IT_GETXATTR;
00354 
00355         maxdata = class_exp2cliimp(exp)->imp_connect_data.ocd_max_easize;
00356 
00357         /* pack the intended request */
00358         mdc_pack_body(req, &op_data->op_fid1, op_data->op_valid, maxdata, -1,
00359                       0);
00360 
00361         req_capsule_set_size(&req->rq_pill, &RMF_EADATA,
00362                                 RCL_SERVER, maxdata);
00363 
00364         req_capsule_set_size(&req->rq_pill, &RMF_EAVALS,
00365                                 RCL_SERVER, maxdata);
00366 
00367         req_capsule_set_size(&req->rq_pill, &RMF_EAVALS_LENS,
00368                                 RCL_SERVER, maxdata);
00369 
00370         ptlrpc_request_set_replen(req);
00371 
00372         RETURN(req);
00373 }
00374 
00375 static struct ptlrpc_request *mdc_intent_unlink_pack(struct obd_export *exp,
00376                                                      struct lookup_intent *it,
00377                                                      struct md_op_data *op_data)
00378 {
00379         struct ptlrpc_request *req;
00380         struct obd_device     *obddev = class_exp2obd(exp);
00381         struct ldlm_intent    *lit;
00382         int                    rc;
00383         ENTRY;
00384 
00385         req = ptlrpc_request_alloc(class_exp2cliimp(exp),
00386                                    &RQF_LDLM_INTENT_UNLINK);
00387         if (req == NULL)
00388                 RETURN(ERR_PTR(-ENOMEM));
00389 
00390         req_capsule_set_size(&req->rq_pill, &RMF_NAME, RCL_CLIENT,
00391                              op_data->op_namelen + 1);
00392 
00393         rc = ldlm_prep_enqueue_req(exp, req, NULL, 0);
00394         if (rc) {
00395                 ptlrpc_request_free(req);
00396                 RETURN(ERR_PTR(rc));
00397         }
00398 
00399         /* pack the intent */
00400         lit = req_capsule_client_get(&req->rq_pill, &RMF_LDLM_INTENT);
00401         lit->opc = (__u64)it->it_op;
00402 
00403         /* pack the intended request */
00404         mdc_unlink_pack(req, op_data);
00405 
00406         req_capsule_set_size(&req->rq_pill, &RMF_MDT_MD, RCL_SERVER,
00407                              obddev->u.cli.cl_default_mds_easize);
00408         ptlrpc_request_set_replen(req);
00409         RETURN(req);
00410 }
00411 
00412 static struct ptlrpc_request *mdc_intent_getattr_pack(struct obd_export *exp,
00413                                                       struct lookup_intent *it,
00414                                                       struct md_op_data *op_data)
00415 {
00416         struct ptlrpc_request   *req;
00417         struct obd_device       *obddev = class_exp2obd(exp);
00418         u64                      valid = OBD_MD_FLGETATTR | OBD_MD_FLEASIZE |
00419                                          OBD_MD_FLMODEASIZE | OBD_MD_FLDIREA |
00420                                          OBD_MD_MEA |
00421                                          (client_is_remote(exp) ?
00422                                           OBD_MD_FLRMTPERM : OBD_MD_FLACL);
00423         struct ldlm_intent      *lit;
00424         int                      rc;
00425         __u32                    easize;
00426         ENTRY;
00427 
00428         req = ptlrpc_request_alloc(class_exp2cliimp(exp),
00429                                    &RQF_LDLM_INTENT_GETATTR);
00430         if (req == NULL)
00431                 RETURN(ERR_PTR(-ENOMEM));
00432 
00433         req_capsule_set_size(&req->rq_pill, &RMF_NAME, RCL_CLIENT,
00434                              op_data->op_namelen + 1);
00435 
00436         rc = ldlm_prep_enqueue_req(exp, req, NULL, 0);
00437         if (rc) {
00438                 ptlrpc_request_free(req);
00439                 RETURN(ERR_PTR(rc));
00440         }
00441 
00442         /* pack the intent */
00443         lit = req_capsule_client_get(&req->rq_pill, &RMF_LDLM_INTENT);
00444         lit->opc = (__u64)it->it_op;
00445 
00446         if (obddev->u.cli.cl_default_mds_easize > 0)
00447                 easize = obddev->u.cli.cl_default_mds_easize;
00448         else
00449                 easize = obddev->u.cli.cl_max_mds_easize;
00450 
00451         /* pack the intended request */
00452         mdc_getattr_pack(req, valid, it->it_flags, op_data, easize);
00453 
00454         req_capsule_set_size(&req->rq_pill, &RMF_MDT_MD, RCL_SERVER, easize);
00455         if (client_is_remote(exp))
00456                 req_capsule_set_size(&req->rq_pill, &RMF_ACL, RCL_SERVER,
00457                                      sizeof(struct mdt_remote_perm));
00458         ptlrpc_request_set_replen(req);
00459         RETURN(req);
00460 }
00461 
00462 static struct ptlrpc_request *mdc_intent_layout_pack(struct obd_export *exp,
00463                                                      struct lookup_intent *it,
00464                                                      struct md_op_data *unused)
00465 {
00466         struct obd_device     *obd = class_exp2obd(exp);
00467         struct ptlrpc_request *req;
00468         struct ldlm_intent    *lit;
00469         struct layout_intent  *layout;
00470         int rc;
00471         ENTRY;
00472 
00473         req = ptlrpc_request_alloc(class_exp2cliimp(exp),
00474                                 &RQF_LDLM_INTENT_LAYOUT);
00475         if (req == NULL)
00476                 RETURN(ERR_PTR(-ENOMEM));
00477 
00478         req_capsule_set_size(&req->rq_pill, &RMF_EADATA, RCL_CLIENT, 0);
00479         rc = ldlm_prep_enqueue_req(exp, req, NULL, 0);
00480         if (rc) {
00481                 ptlrpc_request_free(req);
00482                 RETURN(ERR_PTR(rc));
00483         }
00484 
00485         /* pack the intent */
00486         lit = req_capsule_client_get(&req->rq_pill, &RMF_LDLM_INTENT);
00487         lit->opc = (__u64)it->it_op;
00488 
00489         /* pack the layout intent request */
00490         layout = req_capsule_client_get(&req->rq_pill, &RMF_LAYOUT_INTENT);
00491         /* LAYOUT_INTENT_ACCESS is generic, specific operation will be
00492          * set for replication */
00493         layout->li_opc = LAYOUT_INTENT_ACCESS;
00494 
00495         req_capsule_set_size(&req->rq_pill, &RMF_DLM_LVB, RCL_SERVER,
00496                              obd->u.cli.cl_default_mds_easize);
00497         ptlrpc_request_set_replen(req);
00498         RETURN(req);
00499 }
00500 
00501 static struct ptlrpc_request *
00502 mdc_enqueue_pack(struct obd_export *exp, int lvb_len)
00503 {
00504         struct ptlrpc_request *req;
00505         int rc;
00506         ENTRY;
00507 
00508         req = ptlrpc_request_alloc(class_exp2cliimp(exp), &RQF_LDLM_ENQUEUE);
00509         if (req == NULL)
00510                 RETURN(ERR_PTR(-ENOMEM));
00511 
00512         rc = ldlm_prep_enqueue_req(exp, req, NULL, 0);
00513         if (rc) {
00514                 ptlrpc_request_free(req);
00515                 RETURN(ERR_PTR(rc));
00516         }
00517 
00518         req_capsule_set_size(&req->rq_pill, &RMF_DLM_LVB, RCL_SERVER, lvb_len);
00519         ptlrpc_request_set_replen(req);
00520         RETURN(req);
00521 }
00522 
00523 static int mdc_finish_enqueue(struct obd_export *exp,
00524                               struct ptlrpc_request *req,
00525                               struct ldlm_enqueue_info *einfo,
00526                               struct lookup_intent *it,
00527                               struct lustre_handle *lockh,
00528                               int rc)
00529 {
00530         struct req_capsule  *pill = &req->rq_pill;
00531         struct ldlm_request *lockreq;
00532         struct ldlm_reply   *lockrep;
00533         struct ldlm_lock    *lock;
00534         void                *lvb_data = NULL;
00535         __u32                lvb_len = 0;
00536         ENTRY;
00537 
00538         LASSERT(rc >= 0);
00539         /* Similarly, if we're going to replay this request, we don't want to
00540          * actually get a lock, just perform the intent. */
00541         if (req->rq_transno || req->rq_replay) {
00542                 lockreq = req_capsule_client_get(pill, &RMF_DLM_REQ);
00543                 lockreq->lock_flags |= ldlm_flags_to_wire(LDLM_FL_INTENT_ONLY);
00544         }
00545 
00546         if (rc == ELDLM_LOCK_ABORTED) {
00547                 einfo->ei_mode = 0;
00548                 memset(lockh, 0, sizeof(*lockh));
00549                 rc = 0;
00550         } else { /* rc = 0 */
00551                 lock = ldlm_handle2lock(lockh);
00552                 LASSERT(lock != NULL);
00553 
00554                 /* If the server gave us back a different lock mode, we should
00555                  * fix up our variables. */
00556                 if (lock->l_req_mode != einfo->ei_mode) {
00557                         ldlm_lock_addref(lockh, lock->l_req_mode);
00558                         ldlm_lock_decref(lockh, einfo->ei_mode);
00559                         einfo->ei_mode = lock->l_req_mode;
00560                 }
00561                 LDLM_LOCK_PUT(lock);
00562         }
00563 
00564         lockrep = req_capsule_server_get(pill, &RMF_DLM_REP);
00565         LASSERT(lockrep != NULL); /* checked by ldlm_cli_enqueue() */
00566 
00567         it->it_disposition = (int)lockrep->lock_policy_res1;
00568         it->it_status = (int)lockrep->lock_policy_res2;
00569         it->it_lock_mode = einfo->ei_mode;
00570         it->it_lock_handle = lockh->cookie;
00571         it->it_request = req;
00572 
00573         /* Technically speaking rq_transno must already be zero if
00574          * it_status is in error, so the check is a bit redundant */
00575         if ((!req->rq_transno || it->it_status < 0) && req->rq_replay)
00576                 mdc_clear_replay_flag(req, it->it_status);
00577 
00578         /* If we're doing an IT_OPEN which did not result in an actual
00579          * successful open, then we need to remove the bit which saves
00580          * this request for unconditional replay.
00581          *
00582          * It's important that we do this first!  Otherwise we might exit the
00583          * function without doing so, and try to replay a failed create
00584          * (bug 3440) */
00585         if (it->it_op & IT_OPEN && req->rq_replay &&
00586             (!it_disposition(it, DISP_OPEN_OPEN) || it->it_status != 0))
00587                 mdc_clear_replay_flag(req, it->it_status);
00588 
00589         DEBUG_REQ(D_RPCTRACE, req, "op: %d disposition: %x, status: %d",
00590                   it->it_op, it->it_disposition, it->it_status);
00591 
00592         /* We know what to expect, so we do any byte flipping required here */
00593         if (it->it_op & (IT_OPEN | IT_UNLINK | IT_LOOKUP | IT_GETATTR)) {
00594                 struct mdt_body *body;
00595 
00596                 body = req_capsule_server_get(pill, &RMF_MDT_BODY);
00597                 if (body == NULL) {
00598                         CERROR ("Can't swab mdt_body\n");
00599                         RETURN (-EPROTO);
00600                 }
00601 
00602                 if (it_disposition(it, DISP_OPEN_OPEN) &&
00603                     !it_open_error(DISP_OPEN_OPEN, it)) {
00604                         /*
00605                          * If this is a successful OPEN request, we need to set
00606                          * replay handler and data early, so that if replay
00607                          * happens immediately after swabbing below, new reply
00608                          * is swabbed by that handler correctly.
00609                          */
00610                         mdc_set_open_replay_data(NULL, NULL, it);
00611                 }
00612 
00613                 if (body->mbo_valid & (OBD_MD_FLDIREA | OBD_MD_FLEASIZE)) {
00614                         void *eadata;
00615 
00616                         mdc_update_max_ea_from_body(exp, body);
00617 
00618                         /*
00619                          * The eadata is opaque; just check that it is there.
00620                          * Eventually, obd_unpackmd() will check the contents.
00621                          */
00622                         eadata = req_capsule_server_sized_get(pill, &RMF_MDT_MD,
00623                                                         body->mbo_eadatasize);
00624                         if (eadata == NULL)
00625                                 RETURN(-EPROTO);
00626 
00627                         /* save lvb data and length in case this is for layout
00628                          * lock */
00629                         lvb_data = eadata;
00630                         lvb_len = body->mbo_eadatasize;
00631 
00632                         /*
00633                          * We save the reply LOV EA in case we have to replay a
00634                          * create for recovery.  If we didn't allocate a large
00635                          * enough request buffer above we need to reallocate it
00636                          * here to hold the actual LOV EA.
00637                          *
00638                          * To not save LOV EA if request is not going to replay
00639                          * (for example error one).
00640                          */
00641                         if ((it->it_op & IT_OPEN) && req->rq_replay) {
00642                                 void *lmm;
00643                                 if (req_capsule_get_size(pill, &RMF_EADATA,
00644                                                          RCL_CLIENT) <
00645                                     body->mbo_eadatasize)
00646                                         mdc_realloc_openmsg(req, body);
00647                                 else
00648                                         req_capsule_shrink(pill, &RMF_EADATA,
00649                                                            body->mbo_eadatasize,
00650                                                            RCL_CLIENT);
00651 
00652                                 req_capsule_set_size(pill, &RMF_EADATA,
00653                                                      RCL_CLIENT,
00654                                                      body->mbo_eadatasize);
00655 
00656                                 lmm = req_capsule_client_get(pill, &RMF_EADATA);
00657                                 if (lmm)
00658                                         memcpy(lmm, eadata,
00659                                                body->mbo_eadatasize);
00660                         }
00661                 }
00662 
00663                 if (body->mbo_valid & OBD_MD_FLRMTPERM) {
00664                         struct mdt_remote_perm *perm;
00665 
00666                         LASSERT(client_is_remote(exp));
00667                         perm = req_capsule_server_swab_get(pill, &RMF_ACL,
00668                                                 lustre_swab_mdt_remote_perm);
00669                         if (perm == NULL)
00670                                 RETURN(-EPROTO);
00671                 }
00672         } else if (it->it_op & IT_LAYOUT) {
00673                 /* maybe the lock was granted right away and layout
00674                  * is packed into RMF_DLM_LVB of req */
00675                 lvb_len = req_capsule_get_size(pill, &RMF_DLM_LVB, RCL_SERVER);
00676                 if (lvb_len > 0) {
00677                         lvb_data = req_capsule_server_sized_get(pill,
00678                                                         &RMF_DLM_LVB, lvb_len);
00679                         if (lvb_data == NULL)
00680                                 RETURN(-EPROTO);
00681                 }
00682         }
00683 
00684         /* fill in stripe data for layout lock.
00685          * LU-6581: trust layout data only if layout lock is granted. The MDT
00686          * has stopped sending layout unless the layout lock is granted. The
00687          * client still does this checking in case it's talking with an old
00688          * server. - Jinshan */
00689         lock = ldlm_handle2lock(lockh);
00690         if (lock != NULL && ldlm_has_layout(lock) && lvb_data != NULL &&
00691             !(lockrep->lock_flags & LDLM_FL_BLOCKED_MASK)) {
00692                 void *lmm;
00693 
00694                 LDLM_DEBUG(lock, "layout lock returned by: %s, lvb_len: %d",
00695                         ldlm_it2str(it->it_op), lvb_len);
00696 
00697                 OBD_ALLOC_LARGE(lmm, lvb_len);
00698                 if (lmm == NULL) {
00699                         LDLM_LOCK_PUT(lock);
00700                         RETURN(-ENOMEM);
00701                 }
00702                 memcpy(lmm, lvb_data, lvb_len);
00703 
00704                 /* install lvb_data */
00705                 lock_res_and_lock(lock);
00706                 if (lock->l_lvb_data == NULL) {
00707                         lock->l_lvb_type = LVB_T_LAYOUT;
00708                         lock->l_lvb_data = lmm;
00709                         lock->l_lvb_len = lvb_len;
00710                         lmm = NULL;
00711                 }
00712                 unlock_res_and_lock(lock);
00713                 if (lmm != NULL)
00714                         OBD_FREE_LARGE(lmm, lvb_len);
00715         }
00716         if (lock != NULL)
00717                 LDLM_LOCK_PUT(lock);
00718 
00719         RETURN(rc);
00720 }
00721 
00722 /* We always reserve enough space in the reply packet for a stripe MD, because
00723  * we don't know in advance the file type. */
00724 int mdc_enqueue(struct obd_export *exp,
00725                 struct ldlm_enqueue_info *einfo,
00726                 const union ldlm_policy_data *policy,
00727                 struct lookup_intent *it, struct md_op_data *op_data,
00728                 struct lustre_handle *lockh, __u64 extra_lock_flags)
00729 {
00730         struct obd_device *obddev = class_exp2obd(exp);
00731         struct ptlrpc_request *req = NULL;
00732         __u64 flags, saved_flags = extra_lock_flags;
00733         struct ldlm_res_id res_id;
00734         static const union ldlm_policy_data lookup_policy = {
00735                                   .l_inodebits = { MDS_INODELOCK_LOOKUP } };
00736         static const union ldlm_policy_data update_policy = {
00737                                   .l_inodebits = { MDS_INODELOCK_UPDATE } };
00738         static const union ldlm_policy_data layout_policy = {
00739                                   .l_inodebits = { MDS_INODELOCK_LAYOUT } };
00740         static const union ldlm_policy_data getxattr_policy = {
00741                                   .l_inodebits = { MDS_INODELOCK_XATTR } };
00742         int generation, resends = 0;
00743         struct ldlm_reply *lockrep;
00744         enum lvb_type lvb_type = 0;
00745         int rc;
00746         ENTRY;
00747 
00748         LASSERTF(!it || einfo->ei_type == LDLM_IBITS, "lock type %d\n",
00749                  einfo->ei_type);
00750         fid_build_reg_res_name(&op_data->op_fid1, &res_id);
00751 
00752         if (it != NULL) {
00753                 LASSERT(policy == NULL);
00754 
00755                 saved_flags |= LDLM_FL_HAS_INTENT;
00756                 if (it->it_op & (IT_OPEN | IT_UNLINK | IT_GETATTR | IT_READDIR))
00757                         policy = &update_policy;
00758                 else if (it->it_op & IT_LAYOUT)
00759                         policy = &layout_policy;
00760                 else if (it->it_op & (IT_GETXATTR | IT_SETXATTR))
00761                         policy = &getxattr_policy;
00762                 else
00763                         policy = &lookup_policy;
00764         }
00765 
00766         generation = obddev->u.cli.cl_import->imp_generation;
00767 resend:
00768         flags = saved_flags;
00769         if (it == NULL) {
00770                 /* The only way right now is FLOCK. */
00771                 LASSERTF(einfo->ei_type == LDLM_FLOCK, "lock type %d\n",
00772                          einfo->ei_type);
00773                 res_id.name[3] = LDLM_FLOCK;
00774         } else if (it->it_op & IT_OPEN) {
00775                 req = mdc_intent_open_pack(exp, it, op_data);
00776         } else if (it->it_op & IT_UNLINK) {
00777                 req = mdc_intent_unlink_pack(exp, it, op_data);
00778         } else if (it->it_op & (IT_GETATTR | IT_LOOKUP)) {
00779                 req = mdc_intent_getattr_pack(exp, it, op_data);
00780         } else if (it->it_op & IT_READDIR) {
00781                 req = mdc_enqueue_pack(exp, 0);
00782         } else if (it->it_op & IT_LAYOUT) {
00783                 if (!imp_connect_lvb_type(class_exp2cliimp(exp)))
00784                         RETURN(-EOPNOTSUPP);
00785                 req = mdc_intent_layout_pack(exp, it, op_data);
00786                 lvb_type = LVB_T_LAYOUT;
00787         } else if (it->it_op & IT_GETXATTR) {
00788                 req = mdc_intent_getxattr_pack(exp, it, op_data);
00789         } else {
00790                 LBUG();
00791                 RETURN(-EINVAL);
00792         }
00793 
00794         if (IS_ERR(req))
00795                 RETURN(PTR_ERR(req));
00796 
00797         if (resends) {
00798                 req->rq_generation_set = 1;
00799                 req->rq_import_generation = generation;
00800                 req->rq_sent = cfs_time_current_sec() + resends;
00801         }
00802 
00803         /* It is important to obtain modify RPC slot first (if applicable), so
00804          * that threads that are waiting for a modify RPC slot are not polluting
00805          * our rpcs in flight counter.
00806          * We do not do flock request limiting, though */
00807         if (it) {
00808                 mdc_get_mod_rpc_slot(req, it);
00809                 rc = obd_get_request_slot(&obddev->u.cli);
00810                 if (rc != 0) {
00811                         mdc_put_mod_rpc_slot(req, it);
00812                         mdc_clear_replay_flag(req, 0);
00813                         ptlrpc_req_finished(req);
00814                         RETURN(rc);
00815                 }
00816         }
00817 
00818         rc = ldlm_cli_enqueue(exp, &req, einfo, &res_id, policy, &flags, NULL,
00819                               0, lvb_type, lockh, 0);
00820         if (!it) {
00821                 /* For flock requests we immediatelly return without further
00822                    delay and let caller deal with the rest, since rest of
00823                    this function metadata processing makes no sense for flock
00824                    requests anyway. But in case of problem during comms with
00825                    Server (ETIMEDOUT) or any signal/kill attempt (EINTR), we
00826                    can not rely on caller and this mainly for F_UNLCKs
00827                    (explicits or automatically generated by Kernel to clean
00828                    current FLocks upon exit) that can't be trashed */
00829                 if (((rc == -EINTR) || (rc == -ETIMEDOUT)) &&
00830                     (einfo->ei_type == LDLM_FLOCK) &&
00831                     (einfo->ei_mode == LCK_NL))
00832                         goto resend;
00833                 RETURN(rc);
00834         }
00835 
00836         obd_put_request_slot(&obddev->u.cli);
00837         mdc_put_mod_rpc_slot(req, it);
00838 
00839         if (rc < 0) {
00840                 CDEBUG(D_INFO, "%s: ldlm_cli_enqueue failed: rc = %d\n",
00841                        obddev->obd_name, rc);
00842 
00843                 mdc_clear_replay_flag(req, rc);
00844                 ptlrpc_req_finished(req);
00845                 RETURN(rc);
00846         }
00847 
00848         lockrep = req_capsule_server_get(&req->rq_pill, &RMF_DLM_REP);
00849         LASSERT(lockrep != NULL);
00850 
00851         lockrep->lock_policy_res2 =
00852                 ptlrpc_status_ntoh(lockrep->lock_policy_res2);
00853 
00854         /* Retry infinitely when the server returns -EINPROGRESS for the
00855          * intent operation, when server returns -EINPROGRESS for acquiring
00856          * intent lock, we'll retry in after_reply(). */
00857         if (it && (int)lockrep->lock_policy_res2 == -EINPROGRESS) {
00858                 mdc_clear_replay_flag(req, rc);
00859                 ptlrpc_req_finished(req);
00860                 resends++;
00861 
00862                 CDEBUG(D_HA, "%s: resend:%d op:%d "DFID"/"DFID"\n",
00863                        obddev->obd_name, resends, it->it_op,
00864                        PFID(&op_data->op_fid1), PFID(&op_data->op_fid2));
00865 
00866                 if (generation == obddev->u.cli.cl_import->imp_generation) {
00867                         goto resend;
00868                 } else {
00869                         CDEBUG(D_HA, "resend cross eviction\n");
00870                         RETURN(-EIO);
00871                 }
00872         }
00873 
00874         rc = mdc_finish_enqueue(exp, req, einfo, it, lockh, rc);
00875         if (rc < 0) {
00876                 if (lustre_handle_is_used(lockh)) {
00877                         ldlm_lock_decref(lockh, einfo->ei_mode);
00878                         memset(lockh, 0, sizeof(*lockh));
00879                 }
00880                 ptlrpc_req_finished(req);
00881 
00882                 it->it_lock_handle = 0;
00883                 it->it_lock_mode = 0;
00884                 it->it_request = NULL;
00885         }
00886 
00887         RETURN(rc);
00888 }
00889 
00890 static int mdc_finish_intent_lock(struct obd_export *exp,
00891                                   struct ptlrpc_request *request,
00892                                   struct md_op_data *op_data,
00893                                   struct lookup_intent *it,
00894                                   struct lustre_handle *lockh)
00895 {
00896         struct lustre_handle old_lock;
00897         struct mdt_body *mdt_body;
00898         struct ldlm_lock *lock;
00899         int rc;
00900         ENTRY;
00901 
00902         LASSERT(request != NULL);
00903         LASSERT(request != LP_POISON);
00904         LASSERT(request->rq_repmsg != LP_POISON);
00905 
00906         if (it->it_op & IT_READDIR)
00907                 RETURN(0);
00908 
00909         if (!it_disposition(it, DISP_IT_EXECD)) {
00910                 /* The server failed before it even started executing the
00911                  * intent, i.e. because it couldn't unpack the request. */
00912                 LASSERT(it->it_status != 0);
00913                 RETURN(it->it_status);
00914         }
00915         rc = it_open_error(DISP_IT_EXECD, it);
00916         if (rc)
00917                 RETURN(rc);
00918 
00919         mdt_body = req_capsule_server_get(&request->rq_pill, &RMF_MDT_BODY);
00920         LASSERT(mdt_body != NULL);      /* mdc_enqueue checked */
00921 
00922         rc = it_open_error(DISP_LOOKUP_EXECD, it);
00923         if (rc)
00924                 RETURN(rc);
00925 
00926         /* keep requests around for the multiple phases of the call
00927          * this shows the DISP_XX must guarantee we make it into the call
00928          */
00929         if (!it_disposition(it, DISP_ENQ_CREATE_REF) &&
00930             it_disposition(it, DISP_OPEN_CREATE) &&
00931             !it_open_error(DISP_OPEN_CREATE, it)) {
00932                 it_set_disposition(it, DISP_ENQ_CREATE_REF);
00933                 ptlrpc_request_addref(request); /* balanced in ll_create_node */
00934         }
00935         if (!it_disposition(it, DISP_ENQ_OPEN_REF) &&
00936             it_disposition(it, DISP_OPEN_OPEN) &&
00937             !it_open_error(DISP_OPEN_OPEN, it)) {
00938                 it_set_disposition(it, DISP_ENQ_OPEN_REF);
00939                 ptlrpc_request_addref(request); /* balanced in ll_file_open */
00940                 /* BUG 11546 - eviction in the middle of open rpc processing */
00941                 OBD_FAIL_TIMEOUT(OBD_FAIL_MDC_ENQUEUE_PAUSE, obd_timeout);
00942         }
00943 
00944         if (it->it_op & IT_CREAT) {
00945                 /* XXX this belongs in ll_create_it */
00946         } else if (it->it_op == IT_OPEN) {
00947                 LASSERT(!it_disposition(it, DISP_OPEN_CREATE));
00948         } else {
00949                 LASSERT(it->it_op & (IT_GETATTR | IT_LOOKUP | IT_LAYOUT));
00950         }
00951 
00952         /* If we already have a matching lock, then cancel the new
00953          * one.  We have to set the data here instead of in
00954          * mdc_enqueue, because we need to use the child's inode as
00955          * the l_ast_data to match, and that's not available until
00956          * intent_finish has performed the iget().) */
00957         lock = ldlm_handle2lock(lockh);
00958         if (lock) {
00959                 union ldlm_policy_data policy = lock->l_policy_data;
00960                 LDLM_DEBUG(lock, "matching against this");
00961 
00962                 LASSERTF(fid_res_name_eq(&mdt_body->mbo_fid1,
00963                                          &lock->l_resource->lr_name),
00964                          "Lock res_id: "DLDLMRES", fid: "DFID"\n",
00965                          PLDLMRES(lock->l_resource), PFID(&mdt_body->mbo_fid1));
00966                 LDLM_LOCK_PUT(lock);
00967 
00968                 memcpy(&old_lock, lockh, sizeof(*lockh));
00969                 if (ldlm_lock_match(NULL, LDLM_FL_BLOCK_GRANTED, NULL,
00970                                     LDLM_IBITS, &policy, LCK_NL, &old_lock, 0)) {
00971                         ldlm_lock_decref_and_cancel(lockh, it->it_lock_mode);
00972                         memcpy(lockh, &old_lock, sizeof(old_lock));
00973                         it->it_lock_handle = lockh->cookie;
00974                 }
00975         }
00976 
00977         CDEBUG(D_DENTRY,"D_IT dentry %.*s intent: %s status %d disp %x rc %d\n",
00978                 (int)op_data->op_namelen, op_data->op_name,
00979                 ldlm_it2str(it->it_op), it->it_status,
00980                 it->it_disposition, rc);
00981 
00982         RETURN(rc);
00983 }
00984 
00985 int mdc_revalidate_lock(struct obd_export *exp, struct lookup_intent *it,
00986                         struct lu_fid *fid, __u64 *bits)
00987 {
00988         /* We could just return 1 immediately, but since we should only
00989          * be called in revalidate_it if we already have a lock, let's
00990          * verify that. */
00991         struct ldlm_res_id res_id;
00992         struct lustre_handle lockh;
00993         union ldlm_policy_data policy;
00994         enum ldlm_mode mode;
00995         ENTRY;
00996 
00997         if (it->it_lock_handle) {
00998                 lockh.cookie = it->it_lock_handle;
00999                 mode = ldlm_revalidate_lock_handle(&lockh, bits);
01000         } else {
01001                 fid_build_reg_res_name(fid, &res_id);
01002                 switch (it->it_op) {
01003                 case IT_GETATTR:
01004                         /* File attributes are held under multiple bits:
01005                          * nlink is under lookup lock, size and times are
01006                          * under UPDATE lock and recently we've also got
01007                          * a separate permissions lock for owner/group/acl that
01008                          * were protected by lookup lock before.
01009                          * Getattr must provide all of that information,
01010                          * so we need to ensure we have all of those locks.
01011                          * Unfortunately, if the bits are split across multiple
01012                          * locks, there's no easy way to match all of them here,
01013                          * so an extra RPC would be performed to fetch all
01014                          * of those bits at once for now. */
01015                         /* For new MDTs(> 2.4), UPDATE|PERM should be enough,
01016                          * but for old MDTs (< 2.4), permission is covered
01017                          * by LOOKUP lock, so it needs to match all bits here.*/
01018                         policy.l_inodebits.bits = MDS_INODELOCK_UPDATE |
01019                                                   MDS_INODELOCK_LOOKUP |
01020                                                   MDS_INODELOCK_PERM;
01021                         break;
01022                 case IT_READDIR:
01023                         policy.l_inodebits.bits = MDS_INODELOCK_UPDATE;
01024                         break;
01025                 case IT_LAYOUT:
01026                         policy.l_inodebits.bits = MDS_INODELOCK_LAYOUT;
01027                         break;
01028                 default:
01029                         policy.l_inodebits.bits = MDS_INODELOCK_LOOKUP;
01030                         break;
01031                 }
01032 
01033                 mode = mdc_lock_match(exp, LDLM_FL_BLOCK_GRANTED, fid,
01034                                       LDLM_IBITS, &policy,
01035                                       LCK_CR | LCK_CW | LCK_PR | LCK_PW,
01036                                       &lockh);
01037         }
01038 
01039         if (mode) {
01040                 it->it_lock_handle = lockh.cookie;
01041                 it->it_lock_mode = mode;
01042         } else {
01043                 it->it_lock_handle = 0;
01044                 it->it_lock_mode = 0;
01045         }
01046 
01047         RETURN(!!mode);
01048 }
01049 
01050 /*
01051  * This long block is all about fixing up the lock and request state
01052  * so that it is correct as of the moment _before_ the operation was
01053  * applied; that way, the VFS will think that everything is normal and
01054  * call Lustre's regular VFS methods.
01055  *
01056  * If we're performing a creation, that means that unless the creation
01057  * failed with EEXIST, we should fake up a negative dentry.
01058  *
01059  * For everything else, we want to lookup to succeed.
01060  *
01061  * One additional note: if CREATE or OPEN succeeded, we add an extra
01062  * reference to the request because we need to keep it around until
01063  * ll_create/ll_open gets called.
01064  *
01065  * The server will return to us, in it_disposition, an indication of
01066  * exactly what it_status refers to.
01067  *
01068  * If DISP_OPEN_OPEN is set, then it_status refers to the open() call,
01069  * otherwise if DISP_OPEN_CREATE is set, then it status is the
01070  * creation failure mode.  In either case, one of DISP_LOOKUP_NEG or
01071  * DISP_LOOKUP_POS will be set, indicating whether the child lookup
01072  * was successful.
01073  *
01074  * Else, if DISP_LOOKUP_EXECD then it_status is the rc of the
01075  * child lookup.
01076  */
01077 int mdc_intent_lock(struct obd_export *exp, struct md_op_data *op_data,
01078                     struct lookup_intent *it, struct ptlrpc_request **reqp,
01079                     ldlm_blocking_callback cb_blocking, __u64 extra_lock_flags)
01080 {
01081         struct ldlm_enqueue_info einfo = {
01082                 .ei_type        = LDLM_IBITS,
01083                 .ei_mode        = it_to_lock_mode(it),
01084                 .ei_cb_bl       = cb_blocking,
01085                 .ei_cb_cp       = ldlm_completion_ast,
01086         };
01087         struct lustre_handle lockh;
01088         int rc = 0;
01089         ENTRY;
01090         LASSERT(it);
01091 
01092         CDEBUG(D_DLMTRACE, "(name: %.*s,"DFID") in obj "DFID
01093                 ", intent: %s flags %#"LPF64"o\n", (int)op_data->op_namelen,
01094                 op_data->op_name, PFID(&op_data->op_fid2),
01095                 PFID(&op_data->op_fid1), ldlm_it2str(it->it_op),
01096                 it->it_flags);
01097 
01098         lockh.cookie = 0;
01099         if (fid_is_sane(&op_data->op_fid2) &&
01100             (it->it_op & (IT_LOOKUP | IT_GETATTR | IT_READDIR))) {
01101                 /* We could just return 1 immediately, but since we should only
01102                  * be called in revalidate_it if we already have a lock, let's
01103                  * verify that. */
01104                 it->it_lock_handle = 0;
01105                 rc = mdc_revalidate_lock(exp, it, &op_data->op_fid2, NULL);
01106                 /* Only return failure if it was not GETATTR by cfid
01107                    (from inode_revalidate) */
01108                 if (rc || op_data->op_namelen != 0)
01109                         RETURN(rc);
01110         }
01111 
01112         /* For case if upper layer did not alloc fid, do it now. */
01113         if (!fid_is_sane(&op_data->op_fid2) && it->it_op & IT_CREAT) {
01114                 rc = mdc_fid_alloc(NULL, exp, &op_data->op_fid2, op_data);
01115                 if (rc < 0) {
01116                         CERROR("Can't alloc new fid, rc %d\n", rc);
01117                         RETURN(rc);
01118                 }
01119         }
01120 
01121         rc = mdc_enqueue(exp, &einfo, NULL, it, op_data, &lockh,
01122                          extra_lock_flags);
01123         if (rc < 0)
01124                 RETURN(rc);
01125 
01126         *reqp = it->it_request;
01127         rc = mdc_finish_intent_lock(exp, *reqp, op_data, it, &lockh);
01128         RETURN(rc);
01129 }
01130 
01131 static int mdc_intent_getattr_async_interpret(const struct lu_env *env,
01132                                               struct ptlrpc_request *req,
01133                                               void *args, int rc)
01134 {
01135         struct mdc_getattr_args  *ga = args;
01136         struct obd_export        *exp = ga->ga_exp;
01137         struct md_enqueue_info   *minfo = ga->ga_minfo;
01138         struct ldlm_enqueue_info *einfo = &minfo->mi_einfo;
01139         struct lookup_intent     *it;
01140         struct lustre_handle     *lockh;
01141         struct obd_device        *obddev;
01142         struct ldlm_reply        *lockrep;
01143         __u64                     flags = LDLM_FL_HAS_INTENT;
01144         ENTRY;
01145 
01146         it    = &minfo->mi_it;
01147         lockh = &minfo->mi_lockh;
01148 
01149         obddev = class_exp2obd(exp);
01150 
01151         obd_put_request_slot(&obddev->u.cli);
01152         if (OBD_FAIL_CHECK(OBD_FAIL_MDC_GETATTR_ENQUEUE))
01153                 rc = -ETIMEDOUT;
01154 
01155         rc = ldlm_cli_enqueue_fini(exp, req, einfo->ei_type, 1, einfo->ei_mode,
01156                                    &flags, NULL, 0, lockh, rc);
01157         if (rc < 0) {
01158                 CERROR("ldlm_cli_enqueue_fini: %d\n", rc);
01159                 mdc_clear_replay_flag(req, rc);
01160                 GOTO(out, rc);
01161         }
01162 
01163         lockrep = req_capsule_server_get(&req->rq_pill, &RMF_DLM_REP);
01164         LASSERT(lockrep != NULL);
01165 
01166         lockrep->lock_policy_res2 =
01167                 ptlrpc_status_ntoh(lockrep->lock_policy_res2);
01168 
01169         rc = mdc_finish_enqueue(exp, req, einfo, it, lockh, rc);
01170         if (rc)
01171                 GOTO(out, rc);
01172 
01173         rc = mdc_finish_intent_lock(exp, req, &minfo->mi_data, it, lockh);
01174         EXIT;
01175 
01176 out:
01177         minfo->mi_cb(req, minfo, rc);
01178         return 0;
01179 }
01180 
01181 int mdc_intent_getattr_async(struct obd_export *exp,
01182                              struct md_enqueue_info *minfo)
01183 {
01184         struct md_op_data       *op_data = &minfo->mi_data;
01185         struct lookup_intent    *it = &minfo->mi_it;
01186         struct ptlrpc_request   *req;
01187         struct mdc_getattr_args *ga;
01188         struct obd_device       *obddev = class_exp2obd(exp);
01189         struct ldlm_res_id       res_id;
01190         union ldlm_policy_data policy = {
01191                                 .l_inodebits = { MDS_INODELOCK_LOOKUP |
01192                                                  MDS_INODELOCK_UPDATE } };
01193         int                      rc = 0;
01194         __u64                    flags = LDLM_FL_HAS_INTENT;
01195         ENTRY;
01196 
01197         CDEBUG(D_DLMTRACE, "name: %.*s in inode "DFID", intent: %s flags %#"
01198                 LPF64"o\n",
01199                 (int)op_data->op_namelen, op_data->op_name,
01200                 PFID(&op_data->op_fid1), ldlm_it2str(it->it_op), it->it_flags);
01201 
01202         fid_build_reg_res_name(&op_data->op_fid1, &res_id);
01203         req = mdc_intent_getattr_pack(exp, it, op_data);
01204         if (IS_ERR(req))
01205                 RETURN(PTR_ERR(req));
01206 
01207         rc = obd_get_request_slot(&obddev->u.cli);
01208         if (rc != 0) {
01209                 ptlrpc_req_finished(req);
01210                 RETURN(rc);
01211         }
01212 
01213         rc = ldlm_cli_enqueue(exp, &req, &minfo->mi_einfo, &res_id, &policy,
01214                               &flags, NULL, 0, LVB_T_NONE, &minfo->mi_lockh, 1);
01215         if (rc < 0) {
01216                 obd_put_request_slot(&obddev->u.cli);
01217                 ptlrpc_req_finished(req);
01218                 RETURN(rc);
01219         }
01220 
01221         CLASSERT(sizeof(*ga) <= sizeof(req->rq_async_args));
01222         ga = ptlrpc_req_async_args(req);
01223         ga->ga_exp = exp;
01224         ga->ga_minfo = minfo;
01225 
01226         req->rq_interpret_reply = mdc_intent_getattr_async_interpret;
01227         ptlrpcd_add_req(req);
01228 
01229         RETURN(0);
01230 }
